intro: Sterculia conwentzii, commonly known as the African tallow tree, is a deciduous tree native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The tree produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of soil types and showing some degree of drought tolerance.
